meanings.definition: The quality or state of being princely.
meanings.sent1: Her princeliness shone through in the way she carried herself with grace and dignity.
meanings.sent2: The king admired the princeliness of his son's demeanor at the royal banquet.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to mimic the princeliness of the lion by walking with a regal air.
meanings.sent4: The old castle exuded an air of princeliness, as if it held the secrets of ancient royalty.
meanings.sent5: The artist captured the princeliness of the queen in his portrait, showcasing her royal aura.

meanings.sent1: The prince's princeliness was evident in his noble actions towards his people.
meanings.sent2: The crown symbolized the princeliness of the royal family for generations.
meanings.sent3: The little boy pretended to have the princeliness of a prince by wearing a paper crown.
meanings.sent4: The princeliness of the knight in shining armor inspired awe and admiration among the villagers.
meanings.sent5: The royal carriage gleamed with the princeliness befitting a prince on his coronation day.

meanings.definition: The behavior or mannerisms of a prince.
meanings.sent1: His princeliness was evident in the way he greeted guests with courtesy and respect.
meanings.sent2: The prince's princeliness was admired by all who attended the royal ball.
meanings.sent3: The puppy tried to imitate the princeliness of the prince by sitting with perfect posture.
meanings.sent4: The garden party was filled with the princeliness of the young prince, who charmed everyone with his manners.
meanings.sent5: The play portrayed the princeliness of the prince with grand gestures and regal speech.
